subsubsection.title: The Chain Rule
subsubsection.p: The chain rule relies on being able to decompose a function into smaller pieces, and doing things in the right order.

statement.p: If g is differentiable at x, and f is differentiable at g(x), then the composite function F = f\circ g defined by F(x) = f(g(x)) is differentiable at x, and F'(x) = f'(g(x))\cdot g'(x)
In Leibniz notatation, if y = f(u) and u = g(x) are both differentiable functions, then \dfrac{dy}{dx} = \dfrac{dy}{du}\cdot \dfrac{du}{dx}
